doc.title: Updating plug-ins for Firefox 3.6
doc.sidebarHTML:
1. Firefox releases
    1. Firefox release notes for developers
    2. Experimental features in Firefox
  2. Add-ons
    1. Browser extensions
    2. Themes
  3. Firefox documentation

value.content: Several changes were made in Gecko 1.9.2 that may impact plug-in developers in particular. This article provides a list of those changes.

value.title: Interface changes
value.content: The nsIPluginInstance method destroy() has been removed, since it wasn't doing anything anyway.

value.title: CFM plug-ins no longer supported
value.content: Starting with Gecko 1.9.2, old-style CFM (Code Fragment Manager) binaries are no longer supported for plug-ins. CFM plug-ins have been deprecated since August, 2008.

value.title: main() no longer a supported entry point
value.content: In August, 2008, plug-in developers were informed that main() would no longer be supported as an entry point. This change has taken effect in Gecko 1.9.2. Plug-ins need to be updated to use NPN_GetEntryPoints() instead.

doc.summary: Several changes were made in Gecko 1.9.2 that may impact plug-in developers in particular. This article provides a list of those changes.
